issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://tumblr.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftumblr.com) ### Comment > AdGuard breaking tumblr mobile share links > > I’ve contacted tumblr support about this issue, but wanted to ask AdGuard as well. > > Tumblr recently updated how it does their share links in the mobile app to include tracking analytics. I found a comprehensive explanation here: https://pizza-and-ramen.tumblr.com/post/696959487758745600/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links > > The problem is that with AdGuard enabled, the URL shortening seems to break. And so, in the tumblr mobile app, clicking Share > Copy URL on that same post gives me this monstrosity: > > https://at.tumblr.com/a/key_live_loIM22jCfY1c0N7G2HnBDcmjDCpTeypJ?%24randomized_bundle_token=1102629599139559913&alias=pizza-and-ramen/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links/02dv7jdqyrg2&type=0&duration=0&source=ios&%3D%3D > > Now, putting this in a web browser DOES technically work. It loads/redirects a few times and then eventually resolves to the intended post. But, I obviously would prefer not to be sending people links that look like. well. THAT. > > This is in the tumblr app, not a browser, so safari filters do not apply. Only DNS settings. > > I’m hoping to find a workaround and would appreciate any help. I’ve tried whitelisting the following domains, but it hasn’t helped: > > tumblr.com > at.tumblr.com > tumblr.app.link > api-http2.tumblr.com > branch.io > > Any ideas? Thank you! ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> For user filter
> `tumblr.com#@%#//scriptlet('set-cookie-reload', 'logged_in', '1')`

I’m sorry but could you please explain how to use this filter? I tried copy-pasting it into my iOS app under DNS protection > DNS filtering > DNS filters > add filter, but it won’t even allow me to save it. I’m not very familiar with how to make and use custom filters so I’d really appreciate any help. Thank you!

issue.title: shockwave.org
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://shockwave.org/contact/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fshockwave.org%2Fcontact%2F) ### Comment Username: @pleasantone > In the social rules (blocking-content-rules-social.json), there is the entry: > > "action":{"type":"css-display-none","selector":"#mc_embed_signup"}} > > This selector exists because we are displaying a page that lets users sign up for our mailing list, hosted by MailChimp. This is not a social-networking icon in the slightest. Not sure how it ever got in here, but this feels like a bug. The javascript involved does no tracking (on our site) and doesn't bring in any external cookies or any other weirdness. I think someone jumped the gun here. ### Screenshots

issue.title: Chsnews
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.cbsnews.com/live/video/20230210052207-beloved-composer-burt-bacharach-dies-at-94/#x

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Cant figure out why live videos or normal videos dont play

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142241#issuecomment-1425274602 - I cannot reproduce ads.

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142241#issuecomment-1425448426
>As the first screenshot shown, there is some text outputs on the screen, and these outputs seems to be some error messages. After turning off AdGuard, as the second screenshot shown, these texts disappear. The whole text, which is captured when the website is not loaded completely, is in the fifth screenshot.
I guess these texts may be caused by div#contentContainer.style-scope.tp-yt-app-drawer, the sidebar of YouTube, or something related to that. As the third and the fourth screenshot shown, after deleting that element, these texts disappear.
These texts do not only appear in the home page, but everywhere with the sidebar. And they also move with the sidebar, as the sixth and seventh screenshot shown.
I hope these massages will help you to figure out what happened to this bug. Have a nice day!

That's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist` filter list, please add this rule:
```adblock
youtube.com#@$##contentContainer.tp-yt-app-drawer[swipe-open].tp-yt-app-drawer::after, tp-yt-app-drawer { position: absolute !important; }
```
to user rules or disable this filter list.

comment.body:
If issue still occurs and it's caused by `Stealth mode` - `Protect from DPI`, then please try to add this rule:
```adblock
@@||elearning.ual.pt^$stealth
```
to user rules and then check if website loads correctly.

comment.body:
Regarding - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142444#issue-1578248826
>I think it is a problem with this filter: https://ublockorigin.pages.dev/filters/filters.txt

It seems that it's caused by this rule:
```adblock
www.google.*##:not(:matches-path(/^/search\?.*tbm=shop|^/shopping/)) *:not([class^="sh-sr__shop-result-group"]) [href^="/aclk"][href$="adurl="]:upward(3)
```
Adding to user rules:
```adblock
www.google.*#@#:not(:matches-path(/^/search\?.*tbm=shop|^/shopping/)) *:not([class^="sh-sr__shop-result-group"]) [href^="/aclk"][href$="adurl="]:upward(3)
```
should fixes this issue.
It looks like that issue doesn't occur in latest nightly build, but rules with `:not(:matches-path())` are just ignored (if I'm not wrong).

<hr>

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142444#issuecomment-1425583636 - Please disable `Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion`.

issue.title: Add guildeducation.com domain to Optimizely

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

If users have the AdGuard enabled in their adblocking extensions, then they cannot load our feature flags and a/b tests. The effect is different across our product, such as missing new functionality, new styles, or new versions of existing capabilities. This is especially problematic when we expect all users of a customer to have access to a capability they have paid for.

Here are the websites we are having trouble with

`https://*.guildeducation.com`
`https://optimizely.guildeducation.com/*`
`https://*.guildeducation.com/optimizelydatafile=*`
`https://cdn.optimizely.com/datafiles/* with referrer from https://*.guildeducation.com`

### Proposed solution

Adding `guildeducation.com` to the AllowedList of domains for Optimizely .

### Additional information

Our company’s product, offered through [guildeducation.com](http://guildeducation.com/) does not serve any types of ads or ad-related materials. We are an education benefit provider, helping connect our users to debt-free education. We do use Optimizely for product management best practices of testing new offerings for our users.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://tumblr.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftumblr.com) ### Comment > AdGuard breaking tumblr mobile share links > > I’ve contacted tumblr support about this issue, but wanted to ask AdGuard as well. > > Tumblr recently updated how it does their share links in the mobile app to include tracking analytics. I found a comprehensive explanation here: https://pizza-and-ramen.tumblr.com/post/696959487758745600/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links > > The problem is that with AdGuard enabled, the URL shortening seems to break. And so, in the tumblr mobile app, clicking Share > Copy URL on that same post gives me this monstrosity: > > https://at.tumblr.com/a/key_live_loIM22jCfY1c0N7G2HnBDcmjDCpTeypJ?%24randomized_bundle_token=1102629599139559913&alias=pizza-and-ramen/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links/02dv7jdqyrg2&type=0&duration=0&source=ios&%3D%3D > > Now, putting this in a web browser DOES technically work. It loads/redirects a few times and then eventually resolves to the intended post. But, I obviously would prefer not to be sending people links that look like. well. THAT. > > This is in the tumblr app, not a browser, so safari filters do not apply. Only DNS settings. > > I’m hoping to find a workaround and would appreciate any help. I’ve tried whitelisting the following domains, but it hasn’t helped: > > tumblr.com > at.tumblr.com > tumblr.app.link > api-http2.tumblr.com > branch.io > > Any ideas? Thank you! ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hello,
Thank you for getting back to me. Unfortunately this did not work. 
What I tried:-deleted the tumblr app entirely (I wasn’t sure if cache could influence this so I wanted a clean slate)-applied the rule you gave me to Safari protection > User rules as instructed (the problem however is with the tumblr APP, not the website via safari? I’m not sure if that makes a difference but wanted to note it)-toggled AdGuard protection off and then on again, and clicked the update button to update/convert all rules and filters. Waited for this to finish-waited about 5-10 minutes-re-installed the tumblr app and logged in-tried to copy/share a post. Was given this link:https://bnc.lt/a/key_live_loIM22jCfY1c0N7G2HnBDcmjDCpTeypJ?alias=ruinati0n/enron-intern-1998-feralpumpkincatgirl-some-good/1jivs4tg6s44&type=0&duration=0&source=ios& 

Is there anything else I could try? Thank you very much for your help. 
-Aaron Zorzi


On Friday, February 10, 2023, 8:38 AM, Alex ***@***.***> wrote:




@aaronzorzi Please add it to Safari Protection => User filter and wait ~30-60 seconds (rules applied very slow in iOS).

—

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://tumblr.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftumblr.com) ### Comment > AdGuard breaking tumblr mobile share links > > I’ve contacted tumblr support about this issue, but wanted to ask AdGuard as well. > > Tumblr recently updated how it does their share links in the mobile app to include tracking analytics. I found a comprehensive explanation here: https://pizza-and-ramen.tumblr.com/post/696959487758745600/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links > > The problem is that with AdGuard enabled, the URL shortening seems to break. And so, in the tumblr mobile app, clicking Share > Copy URL on that same post gives me this monstrosity: > > https://at.tumblr.com/a/key_live_loIM22jCfY1c0N7G2HnBDcmjDCpTeypJ?%24randomized_bundle_token=1102629599139559913&alias=pizza-and-ramen/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links/02dv7jdqyrg2&type=0&duration=0&source=ios&%3D%3D > > Now, putting this in a web browser DOES technically work. It loads/redirects a few times and then eventually resolves to the intended post. But, I obviously would prefer not to be sending people links that look like. well. THAT. > > This is in the tumblr app, not a browser, so safari filters do not apply. Only DNS settings. > > I’m hoping to find a workaround and would appreciate any help. I’ve tried whitelisting the following domains, but it hasn’t helped: > > tumblr.com > at.tumblr.com > tumblr.app.link > api-http2.tumblr.com > branch.io > > Any ideas? Thank you! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/XgLYzUo.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/FLuMpGB.jpg)

Да, Extra используется для "особых" случаев. В программе это расширение включено по умолчанию. 
Пока закрывают. Отвечать по-прежнему можно, но лучше отправлять новую жалобу, если появится реклама.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.cman.jp/network/support/go_access.cgi](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cman.jp%2Fnetwork%2Fsupport%2Fgo_access.cgi) ### Comment > Please click the link highlighted in the first screenshot. Still cannot reproduce the situation? > > Here is some additional information. > When I click the link in Safari, Safari says that the tracker "google-analytics.com" is prevented from profiling me (refer to the second screenshot). This may indicate that AdGuard fails to block some trackers from Google Analytics. > The third through fifth screenshots show the chrome pages of https://www.cman.jp/network/support/go_access.cgi > https://www.if-so.com/what-is-your-referrer/ > https://whatsmyreferer.com/ > that are accessed via the Google Search page.
